etymologies: early 19th century; earliest use found in Helen Maria Williams (1761–1827), writer. From scientific Latin Simaroubaceae, (also) Simarubaceae + -ous

definitions: Belonging to or characteristic of the family Simaroubaceae of chiefly tropical trees and shrubs, which includes the genera Ailanthus, Quassia, Simarouba, and others.

notes.text: A number of genera have recently been moved to other families.
